001// SPDX-License-Identifier: GPL-3.0-or-later
002
003package es.uvigo.esei.sing.textproc.persistence;
004
005import java.util.Iterator;
006import java.util.Map;
007import java.util.Set;
008import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
009import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentSkipListSet;
010import java.util.logging.Level;
011
012import javax.persistence.EntityManager;
013import javax.persistence.EntityManagerFactory;
014import javax.persistence.EntityTransaction;
015import javax.persistence.MappedSuperclass;
016import javax.persistence.PersistenceException;
017
018import org.hibernate.cfg.Configuration;
019import org.hibernate.jpa.boot.internal.ParsedPersistenceXmlDescriptor;
020import org.hibernate.jpa.boot.internal.PersistenceXmlParser;
021
022import es.uvigo.esei.sing.textproc.logging.TextProcLogging;
023import lombok.AccessLevel;
024import lombok.NoArgsConstructor;
025import lombok.NonNull;
026
027/**
028 * Entry point to the TextProc persistence access functionalities.
029 *
030 * @author Alejandro González García
031 * @implNote The implementation of this class is thread-safe.
032 * @version $Id: $Id
033 */
034@NoArgsConstructor(access = AccessLevel.PRIVATE)
035public class TextProcPersistence {
036        private static final String NOT_RUNNING_ERROR_MESSAGE = "The persistence access layer is not running";
037
038        private volatile EntityManagerFactory entityManagerFactory = null;
039        private final Map<Thread, EntityManager> threadEntityManager = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
040        private final Set<TimestampedEntityTransaction> dirtyTransactions = new ConcurrentSkipListSet<>();
041        private final Object runningStatusChangeLock = new Object();
042
043        /**
044         * Utility class for the <a href=
045         * "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Initialization-on-demand_holder_idiom">initialization
046         * on demand holder idiom</a>.
047         *
048         * @author Alejandro González García
049         */
050        private static final class TextProcPersistenceInstanceHolder {
051                private static final TextProcPersistence INSTANCE = new TextProcPersistence();
052        }
053
054        /**
055         * Returns the only instance of this class in the JVM. This method always
056         * returns the same object.
057         *
058         * @return The only instance of this class in the JVM.
059         */
060        public static TextProcPersistence get() {
061                return TextProcPersistenceInstanceHolder.INSTANCE;
062        }
063
064        /**
065         * Checks whether this persistence access layer is running. When not running,
066         * most method calls on it will throw a {@link java.lang.IllegalStateException}, as
067         * documented.
068         *
069         * @return True if the persistence access layer is running, false otherwise.
070         */
071        public boolean isRunning() {
072                return entityManagerFactory != null;
073        }
074
075        /**
076         * Starts the TextProc persistence access layer, so it becomes ready to process
077         * data access operations.
078         *
079         * @param entityTypes A set of entity types that the JPA provider will analyze,
080         *                    in order to make them available for use. The set doesn't
081         *                    need to be modifiable.
082         * @throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException If {@code entityTypes} is {@code null}, or
083         *                                  contains a {@code null} element.
084         */
085        public void start(@NonNull final Set<Class<?>> entityTypes) {
086                synchronized (runningStatusChangeLock) {
087                        if (entityManagerFactory == null) {
088                                final Configuration entityManagerFactoryConfiguration = new Configuration();
089
090                                // We need to use Hibernate specific API to add entities that are not in
091                                // our JAR, because they were provided by other modules, and do this before
092                                // creating the session factory (EntityManagerFactory), because it is immutable.
093                                // It's not pretty, but it's the only possibility that allows dynamic entities
094                                for (final Class<?> entityType : entityTypes) {
095                                        if (entityType == null) {
096                                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("A entity type can't be null");
097                                        }
098
099                                        entityManagerFactoryConfiguration.addAnnotatedClass(entityType);
100
101                                        // Add mapped superclasses too
102                                        Class<?> entitySuperclass = entityType.getSuperclass();
103                                        while (
104                                                entitySuperclass != null &&
105                                                entitySuperclass.getDeclaredAnnotation(MappedSuperclass.class) != null
106                                        ) {
107                                                entityManagerFactoryConfiguration.addAnnotatedClass(entitySuperclass);
108                                                entitySuperclass = entitySuperclass.getSuperclass();
109                                        }
110                                }
111
112                                final ParsedPersistenceXmlDescriptor persistenceDescriptor = PersistenceXmlParser.locateNamedPersistenceUnit(
113                                        TextProcPersistence.class.getResource("/META-INF/persistence.xml"),
114                                        TextProcPersistence.class.getSimpleName()
115                                );
116
117                                // Code examination of the previous method call reveals that an exception should
118                                // be thrown in this case. But Javadoc is weak about this, so be safe
119                                if (persistenceDescriptor == null) {
120                                        throw new PersistenceException("Couldn't parse the persistence descriptor");
121                                }
122
123                                entityManagerFactory = entityManagerFactoryConfiguration.addProperties(
124                                        persistenceDescriptor.getProperties()
125                                ).buildSessionFactory();
126                        }
127                }
128        }
129
130        /**
131         * Stops the TextProc persistence access layer, so that all pending transactions
132         * are finished and no new data access operations can start until it is started
133         * again (if ever).
134         */
135        public void stop() {
136                synchronized (runningStatusChangeLock) {
137                        final EntityManagerFactory currentEntityManagerFactory = entityManagerFactory;
138                        if (currentEntityManagerFactory != null) {
139                                // Null the attribute first, so other threads see us as stopped
140                                entityManagerFactory = null;
141
142                                // Now close the entity manager factory
143                                currentEntityManagerFactory.close();
144                                flushEntities(true);
145                        }
146                }
147        }
148
149        /**
150         * Returns a entity manager ready for use for the current thread. At any given
151         * time, there can be one entity manager per thread that requests one.
152         *
153         * @return The entity manager exclusive to the current thread.
154         * @throws java.lang.IllegalStateException If the persistence access layer is not running.
155         */
156        public EntityManager getEntityManager() {
157                if (!isRunning()) {
158                        throw new IllegalStateException(NOT_RUNNING_ERROR_MESSAGE);
159                }
160
161                return threadEntityManager.compute(
162                        Thread.currentThread(),
163                        (final Thread key, final EntityManager value) -> {
164                                return value == null ?
165                                        new EntityManagerTransactionDecorator(
166                                                entityManagerFactory.createEntityManager(),
167                                                (final EntityTransaction transaction) ->
168                                                        dirtyTransactions.add(new TimestampedEntityTransaction(transaction))
169                                        )
170                                : value;
171                        }
172                );
173        }
174
175        /**
176         * Commits the dirty transactions which were not rolled back, and then closes
177         * all the opened entity managers. If other parts of the application are using
178         * entity transactions when this method is invoked, its outcome is undefined.
179         * Otherwise, when this method returns, no transaction or entity manager will
180         * remain to be committed, closed or strongly referenced by internal data
181         * structures (therefore, they can be garbage collected, barring strong
182         * references elsewhere). Subsequent calls to {@link #getEntityManager()} will
183         * return new entity manager objects no matter what.
184         *
185         * @throws java.lang.IllegalStateException If the application is not running.
186         */
187        public void flushEntities() {
188                flushEntities(false);
189        }
190
191        /**
192         * Commits the dirty transactions which were not rolled back, and then closes
193         * all the opened entity managers. If other parts of the application are using
194         * entity transactions when this method is invoked, its outcome is undefined.
195         * Otherwise, when this method returns, no transaction or entity manager will
196         * remain to be committed, closed or strongly referenced by internal data
197         * structures (therefore, they can be garbage collected, barring strong
198         * references elsewhere). Subsequent calls to {@link #getEntityManager()} will
199         * return new entity manager objects no matter what.
200         *
201         * @param ignoreRunningStatus If {@code true}, the code won't check that this
202         *                            data access layer is running before finishing
203         *                            pending transactions. This is only meant for
204         *                            internal use.
205         *
206         * @throws IllegalStateException If the application is not running and
207         *                               {@code ignoreRunningStatus} is set to
208         *                               {@code false}.
209         */
210        private void flushEntities(final boolean ignoreRunningStatus) {
211                if (!ignoreRunningStatus && !isRunning()) {
212                        throw new IllegalStateException(NOT_RUNNING_ERROR_MESSAGE);
213                }
214
215                // Commit transactions in the same order that were created.
216                // This avoids database lock wait timeouts that can occur with RDBMS
217                // that schedule transactions in a way that doesn't guarantee that no
218                // deadlocks will occur when committing them in any order. See:
219                // https://stackoverflow.com/questions/13966467/how-to-avoid-lock-wait-timeout-exceeded-exception
220                final Iterator<TimestampedEntityTransaction> dirtyTransactionsIter = dirtyTransactions.iterator();
221                while (dirtyTransactionsIter.hasNext()) {
222                        final EntityTransaction transaction = dirtyTransactionsIter.next().getEntityTransaction();
223
224                        try {
225                                if (transaction.isActive()) {
226                                        if (transaction.getRollbackOnly()) {
227                                                transaction.rollback();
228                                        } else {
229                                                transaction.commit();
230                                        }
231                                }
232                        } catch (final Exception exc) {
233                                TextProcLogging.getLogger().log(
234                                        Level.WARNING,
235                                        "An exception occurred while committing or rolling back a transaction. The database status may be inconsistent",
236                                        exc
237                                );
238                        }
239
240                        dirtyTransactionsIter.remove();
241                }
242
243                threadEntityManager
244                        .values().parallelStream()
245                        .forEach(
246                                (final EntityManager entityManager) -> {
247                                        try {
248                                                if (entityManager.isOpen()) {
249                                                        entityManager.close();
250                                                }
251                                        } catch (final Exception exc) {
252                                                TextProcLogging.getLogger().log(
253                                                        Level.WARNING, "An exception occurred while closing a entity manager", exc
254                                                );
255                                        }
256                                }
257                        );
258                threadEntityManager.clear();
259        }
260}
